benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Retrieve invoice item tags

covered: Valid requests: Success paths are well covered (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06) including combinations of optional parameters.
Query parameters: Many valid and invalid combinations are tested (includedDeleted true/invalid, audit FULL/MINIMAL/invalid, missing accountId, extra unexpected params).
Error handling: 400 and 404 error scenarios for invalid formats and missing/non-existent resources are covered (TC07-TC11, TC26, TC27).
Authentication/Authorization: Missing/invalid token is tested (HTTP 401 in TC12).
Schema & audit content: Tag schema conformance is asserted (TC01) and audit content checks exist for FULL and MINIMAL (TC03, TC04).
Deleted-tags behavior & regression: includedDeleted behavior and a regression test are present (TC02, TC23, TC06).
Security: Injection and XSS checks are present (TC19, TC20) to avoid sensitive data leakage and execution/reflection.
Resilience & integration: Backend unavailability and integration with audit logging have test cases (TC18, TC24, TC25).
Performance: Normal and peak load performance tests are present (TC21, TC22).
State/edge variations: Empty DB and partially populated DB states are covered (TC26, TC27); edge ID-length scenarios are also included (TC16, TC17).
gaps: Pagination: No tests for pagination or large-result pagination semantics (limit/offset/page tokens, total counts, ordering) — if the endpoint supports paging, this is missing.
Caching / conditional GET: No tests validate response headers (Content-Type, ETag, Cache-Control) or conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match -> 304).
Rate limiting / throttling: No explicit tests for rate limiting (429) or throttling behaviour — performance tests do not verify throttling or Retry-After semantics.
Default parameter behavior not asserted explicitly: audit default = NONE and includedDeleted default = false are not explicitly validated in a dedicated test.
Response headers and content-negotiation: Tests do not assert "Content-Type: application/json" or behavior with different Accept headers.
403 / insufficient privileges: No tests for authenticated-but-unauthorized users (403) or RBAC/permission-related rejections.

Error response schema: Tests check for error messages but do not validate a consistent error response schema (fields, codes, machine-readable error structure) or ensure no sensitive info in all error paths.
Pagination & large dataset performance: There are no tests combining very large datasets with correctness checks (e.g., partial responses, streaming, memory/CPU impact).
Unrealistic edge-case tests: TC16/TC17 test min/max UUID lengths which is inconsistent with fixed-length UUID spec — needs clarification or replacement with realistic boundary/malformed tests.
recommendations: Add pagination tests (if supported): seed >page-size tags and verify limit/offset or page token semantics, total counts, consistent ordering and stability across pages.
Add caching & conditional GET tests: assert Content-Type header, presence/format of ETag and Cache-Control, test If-None-Match -> 304 semantics and behavior when resources change (ETag changes).
Add explicit tests for default query parameter values: verify that omitting audit returns NONE behavior and that omitting includedDeleted excludes deleted tags.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests: burst requests to validate 429 responses, Retry-After header semantics, and system recovery after throttling.
Add 403/authorization-scope tests: exercise an authenticated user lacking necessary permissions (if RBAC applies) to confirm 403 behavior.
Enhance schema validation: assert Tag object field-level types and presence, and strict structure of audit metadata for FULL and MINIMAL modes.
Assert response headers and content negotiation: validate Content-Type, charset, and behavior with unsupported/alternate Accept headers.
Harden security tests: expand injection vectors, ensure error responses never leak stack traces or internal identifiers across all error paths.
Replace or clarify UUID length edge tests with realistic malformed UUID cases (wrong length, invalid characters) consistent with UUID spec.
Add concurrency/race-condition tests where applicable: read-while-delete or concurrent tag modifications to validate consistency and soft-delete visibility under concurrency.
